Scopenote: Photo showing the burial tomb of Abraham Lincoln in Springfield, Illinois.

Scopenote: Photo showing the Wabash Freight Station in Springfield, Illinois where Abraham Lincoln gave his famous farewell speech to the residents of Springfield before leaving for Washington D.C. as President-elect.

Scopenote: Unidentified officer of the National Council of American Indians is shown with Philleo Nash, Commissioner of Indian Affairs. This is evidently a meeting near Boise, Idaho.

Scopenote: Unidentified officer of the National Council of American Indians is shown with Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash. They are evidently at a meeting in Boise, Idaho.

Scopenote: Unidentified group of men standing behind former President Harry S. Truman, who is seated at his desk in his Harry S. Truman Library office. They are probably from Hannibal, Missouri.  From:  Brown leather album, gift from George D. Clayton, Jr., Hannibal, MO.

Scopenote: Garden Room in the Harry S. Truman Library museum.  From:  Brown leather album, gift from George D. Clayton, Jr., Hannibal, MO.

Scopenote: Unidentified men at an unknown location, photo probably connected to NASA.

title: Photo from LIFE Space Tour of NASA's Ames Research Center
Scopenote: Photo from LIFE Space Tour of NASA's Ames Research Center at Moffett Field, California.  Photo appears to be of some sort of radio or transmitter.

title: Painting of the Sailing Ship U.S.S. Independence (1814-1913) by Rear Admiral Schmidt
Scopenote: Painting of the U.S.S. Independence (1814-1913) by Rear Admiral Schmidt for the new U.S.S. Independence (CVA-62).  Original photo is 16x20 and stored in the oversize file.  From:  HST estate 12/3/74.  Transferred from Museum Collection 5/28/75.

Scopenote: 11x14 photo of the restored front parlor of the home of Abraham Lincoln in Springfield, Illinois.

title: Photo of an inscribed rock marking the site of speeches by Douglas and Lincoln
Scopenote: 11x14 photo showing a rock inscribed with the words "Site of Speeches by Douglas and Lincoln, September 30 - Oct. 4, 1858" in Springfield, Illinois.

title: Portrait of Truman with hands folded as he speaks
Scopenote: 14 x 16 color portrait of Harry S. Truman, hands folded in front, as he speaks. This has been reversed when printed, as hair is parted on the wrong side for Mr. Truman. Oversized original photo is in drawer 8 of the oversized photo file. File print is black and white copy.  From:  HST estate 12/3/74; transferred from Museum Collection 5/28/75.

title: Lyndon B. Johnson and Lady Bird Johnson Greeting James Webb at Airport
Scopenote: President Lyndon B. Johnson and Lady Bird Johnson (she is at left) are shown greeting an unidentified couple at an airport. NASA head, James E. Webb, and his wife, Patsy, are on the far right.

title: James E. Webb, Strom Thurmond in Group Photo
Scopenote: Senator Strom Thurmond (third from left) and James E. Webb (fourth from left), Administrator of NASA, sits in a large group photograph.  The event is unknown.

title: Patsy Webb listens to an unidentified man
Scopenote: Patsy Webb, wife of NASA Administrator James E. Webb, smiles as she listens to an unidentified man during a dinner party.

title: James E. Webb with others during a dinner party
Scopenote: NASA Administrator James E. Webb (third from left), is shown with other unidentified men during a dinner party.

title: Distance View of Paul Griffith and Louis Johnson at Unidentified Event

Scopenote: President Lyndon B. Johnson (far right) and James E. Webb, NASA head, (seated second from left) with unidentified others during a banquet at the Sheraton Park Hotel in Washington, D.C.

Scopenote: Persian rug and Philippine table exhibit at the Harry S. Truman Library.  From:  Brown leather album, gift from George D. Clayton, Jr., Hannibal, MO.

title: Portrait of Mrs. Woodrow Wilson and Her Three Daughters
Scopenote: Formal portrait of Ellen Louise Axson Wilson, wife of Woodrow Wilson, and their three daughters, taken at the White House. Mrs. Wilson died August 6, 1914. The daughters are: Margaret Woodrow Wilson, Jessie Woodrow Wilson, and Eleanor Randolph Wilson. From: HST estate 12/3/74; transferred from Museum Collection 5/28/75.

title: Formal Portrait of Mrs. Woodrow Wilson and Her Three Daughters
Scopenote: Formal portrait of Ellen Louise Axson Wilson, wife of Woodrow Wilson, and their three daughters at the White House. Almost the same as 98-120. Mrs. Wilson died on August 6, 1914. From: HST estate 12/3/74; transferred from Museum Collection 5/28/75.

title: Formal portrait of the Franklin D. Roosevelt family taken at their home
Scopenote: Formal portrait of the Franklin D. Roosevelt family (Franklin, Eleanor, and their children) taken at their home while Mr. Roosevelt was Assistant Secretary of the Navy.    From:  Harry S. Truman estate 12/3/74; transferred from Museum Collection 5/28/75.

title: Truman at American Legion National Commanders Banquet
Scopenote: Senator Harry Truman is shown at the center below the drawn arrow, attending the American Legion National Commanders Banquet at the Statler Hotel in Cleveland, Ohio in this 10 x 20 photo.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Thomas J. Pendergast at the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia in 1936
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman and Thomas J. Pendergast at the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia in 1936.

title: Fort Leavenworth Command and General Staff School members
Scopenote: 8x19 magazine weight photo showing the members of the Command and General Staff School held at Fort Leavenworth, KS, January, 1943.

title: Fort Leavenworth Third Army Orientation Course members
Scopenote: 8x19 magazine weight photo showing the members of the Third Army Orientation Course held at Fort Leavenworth, KS, January, 1943.

title: Martin Rosenberg and Gil Weiss talking before a dinner in honor of Robert E. Hannegan
Scopenote: Martin Rosenberg and Gil Weiss sit together and talk before a dinner honoring Robert E. Hannegan as  the newly appointed Commissioner of Internal Revenue.  From: The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue

title: Robert E. Hannegan Stands at the Podium During the Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Dinner
Scopenote: Robert E. Hannegan, newly appointed Commissioner of the Internal Revenue, stands at the podium during the Knights of the Cauliflower Ear dinner honoring him.  It was held at the Coronado Hotel in St. Louis.  From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Dining Room of the Coronado Hotel in St. Louis
Scopenote: The dining room of the Coronado Hotel in St. Louis before the Knights of the Cauliflower Ear dinner honoring Robert E. Hannegan, Commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service. From: The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Western Union Telegram from Louis E. Miller to Horace B. Deal Regarding a Dinner for Robert E. Hannegan
Scopenote: Photo of a Western Union telegram from Louis E. Miller to Horace B. Deal expressing regrets for his inability to attend the dinner given in honor of Internal Revenue Commissioner Robert E. Hannegan.  From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Dinner in honor of Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of the Internal Revenue
Scopenote: Shown together during a dinner in honor of Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of the Internal Revenue are Lt. Col. Harry Vaughan, Joe Holland, Leo Laughren, Ralph Toesnfeldt and Senator Harry Truman.   From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Telegram expressing regrets of Paul E. Winter for not being able to attend a dinner honoring Robert E. Hannegan
Scopenote: A photo of a Western Union telegram to Robert E. Hannegan expressing regrets of Paul E. Winter not being able to attend the dinner honoring Hannegan as Commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service.  From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Photo of the Invitation by the Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Honoring the Presidential appointment of Robert E. Hannigan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue
Scopenote: Photo of the invitation by the Knights of the Cauliflower Ear announcing their 38th meeting to honor the Presidential appointment of Robert E. Hannigan to the office of Commissioner of Internal Revenue.  From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Robert E. Hannegan and Barney Dickmann
Scopenote: Shown together during the Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Dinner honoring the Presidential appointment of Robert E. Hannegan as Internal Revenue Commissioner, are Mr. Hannegan and former St. Louis mayor Bernard (Barney) Dickmann.  They are at the Coronado Hotel in St. Louis.  From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Photo of a telegram from James A. Farley with regrets that he cannot attend a dinner honoring Robert E. Hannegan
Scopenote: Photo of a Western Union telegram sent to Robert E. Hannegan by James A. Farley, Democratic National Chairman, with regrets that he cannot attend the dinner honoring Hannegan on his Presidential appointment as Commissioner Internal Revenue.  From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Robert E. Hannegan addressing attendees during a dinner honoring him as Commissioner of Internal Revenue
Scopenote: Robert E. Hannegan addressing attendees during a dinner honoring him as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.  From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Photo of a Letter of Regret by Henry Morgenthau, Jr., to Charles P. Orchard, Chairman of the Invitation Committee, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear
Scopenote: Photo of a letter of regret by Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau, Jr. to Charles P. Orchard, Chairman of the Invitation Committee, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear. Morgenthau will be unable to attend the dinner honoring Robert E. Hannegan as newly appointed Commissioner Internal Revenue Service. The letter is signed by Morgenthau. From: The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Overview of the head table and other guests during the dinner honoring Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner Internal Revenue
Scopenote: Overview of the head table and other guests during the dinner honoring Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner Internal Revenue. The dinner is at the Coronado Hotel in St. Louis, Missouri. Senator Harry S. Truman is seen right of center at the head table and Robert E. Hannegan, honoree, left of center, head table.  From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Photo of Telegram of Regrets from President Roosevelt's Secretary, Edwin M. Watson, to Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Dinner
Scopenote: Photo of telegram of regrets from President Franklin D. Roosevelt's secretary, Edwin M. Watson, stating the President will be unable to attend the dinner honoring Internal Revenue Commissioner Robert E. Hannegan that is sponsored by the Knights of the Cauliflower Ear.   From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Telegram to Senator Harry Truman from Bennett Champ Clark Sending Regrets that he will not be able to Attend the Hannegan Dinner
Scopenote: Photo of a Western Union telegram to Senator Harry Truman from Bennett Champ Clark sending regrets that he will not be able to attend the dinner honoring Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner Internal Revenue.  From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Telegram Expressing Regrets of F. Flores, Jr
Scopenote: A photo of a Western Union telegram to Robert E. Hannegan expressing regrets of F. Flores, Jr. for not being able to attend the Knights of the Cauliflower Ear dinner honoring Hannegan as newly appointed Commissioner Internal Revenue.  From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Photo of a Western Union Telegram to Robert E. Hannegan from Bennett Champ Clark
Scopenote: Photo of a Western Union telegram to Robert E. Hannegan from Bennett Champ Clark, sending regrets that he will be unable to attend the dinner honoring Mr. Hannegan as the new Commissioner of the Internal Revenue.  From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Robert Hannegan and Stuart Symington at a Dinner
Scopenote: Robert E. Hannegan (left) and Stuart Symington at a dinner of the Knights of the Cauliflower Ear celebrating the appointment of Mr. Hannegan as Internal Revenue Service Commissioner. They are at the Coronado Hotel in St. Louis, Missouri. From: The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Robert E. Hannegan standing at microphone during a dinner honoring his appointment as Internal Revenue Commissioner
Scopenote: Robert E. Hannegan standing at a microphone during a dinner honoring his appointment as Internal Revenue Commissioner.  The dinner was held at the Coronado Hotel in St. Louis, Missouri.  From:  The Album, Knights of the Cauliflower Ear Proudly Acclaim the Presidential Appointment of Hon. Robert E. Hannegan as Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

title: Telegram from J. K. Vardaman, Jr
Scopenote: J. K. Vardaman, Jr. send regrets to Horace B. Deal for not being able to attend the dinner in honor of Robert E. Hannegan as newly appointed Commissioner of Internal Revenue Service.  This is a photo of the Western Union telegram.

title: Dean Acheson and others during the Thanksgiving Dinner of the Canadian delegation of the UNRRA Conference
Scopenote: Dean Acheson, center front, and unidentified others during the Thanksgiving Dinner of the Canadian delegation of the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration Conference.
Institutional Creator: Fred Hess & Son, Atlantic City, NJ

title: Portrait of Ernest J. King, Fleet Admiral
Scopenote: Color portrait of Fleet Admiral Ernest J. King (1878-1956), Chief of Naval Operations, 1942-1945.

title: Robert E. Hannegan (center), Chairman of the Democratic National Committee, at Washington's Birthday Dinner, Dallas
Scopenote: Shown with two unidentified men, Robert E. Hannegan (center), Chairman of the Democratic National Committee, is wearing the Big Chief #13 hat of the Bonehead Club of Dallas. Photo taken at Washington's Birthday Dinner in Dallas, TX.  From:  Scrapbook gift to Robert Hannegan from Joe C. Luther.

title: Robert E. Hannegan shown at a Desk During Washington's Birthday Dinner in Dallas, Texas
Scopenote: Democratic National Chairman Robert E. Hannegan shown at a desk in his room during the Washington's Birthday Dinner in Dallas, Texas.  From:  Scrapbook gift to Robert Hannegan from Joe C. Luther.

title: Robert E. Hannegan Shakes Hands With Edwin Pauley at the Washington's Birthday Dinner in Dallas, Texas
Scopenote: Robert E. Hannegan, Democratic National Chairman, shakes hands with Edwin Pauley, Treasurer of the National Democratic Committee, at the Washington's Birthday Dinner in Dallas, Texas. Other man unidentified. From: Scrapbook gift to Robert Hannegan from Joe C. Luther.

title: Senator Truman at the Democratic Convention in Chicago
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman sips coffee during states roll call at the Democratic Convention in Chicago after his nomination for the Vice Presidential spot.

title: Senator Truman, Bess and Margaret at the Democratic Convention waiting out the states roll call for the Truman Vice-Presidency
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman, Bess and Margaret Truman are at the Democratic Convention waiting out the states roll call for the Truman Vice-Presidency. Others in photo unidentified.

title: Bess Truman and Margaret Truman after the nomination of Senator Truman as the Vice Presidential candidate at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Bess Truman and Margaret Truman at the Democratic Convention, celebrating after the nomination of Senator Harry S. Truman (not in photograph) as the Vice Presidential candidate.

title: Edward J. Kelley with Senator Truman
Scopenote: Chicago Mayor Edward J. Kelley raises the hand of Senator Harry S. Truman following the victorious roll call nominating Truman for the Vice-Presidency.

title: Senator Truman beside the Andrew Jackson statue
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman is shown standing beside the Andrew Jackson statue in front of the Jackson County Courthouse in Kansas City, Missouri.  He is the Vice Presidential candidate, on the ticket with President Franklin D. Roosevelt.

title: Senator Truman being congratulated upon his Democratic Vice Presidential nomination by Senators Homer Ferguson, Harold H. Burton, Tom Connally and Ralph Brewster
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman being congratulated upon his Democratic Vice Presidential nomination by Senators Homer Ferguson, Harold H. Burton, Tom Connally and Owen Brewster.

title: A photo of a 3-cent stamp showing American troops marching in front of the Arc de Triomphe in Paris
Scopenote: A photo of a 3-cent stamp showing hundreds of American troops marching in formation in front of the Arc de Triomphe in Paris as they liberate France.  This is the same image as photograph 98-2517, but airplanes have been added to the stamp.  This photograph came with a negative.  From:  Presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters, U. S. Army Forces Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: American soldiers marching in Paris
Scopenote: Hundreds of American troops are shown marching in formation in front of the Arc de Triomphe, completed in 1836, in Paris, France.  Presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters, U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, 1946. This photo was the basis of the three-cent stamp (see photograph 98-2518).  A 4x5 negative came with the photograph.

title: Missouri Senator Harry S. Truman, Democratic Vice Presidential candidate, speaking in Peoria, Illinois
Scopenote: Missouri Senator Harry S. Truman, Democratic Vice Presidential candidate, speaking in Peoria, Illinois.  Senator Truman is denying the charges that started in 1922 that he was a former member of the Ku Klux Klan.

title: Photo from pages of Philadelphia Inquirer of Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945
Scopenote: Photo from pages of Philadelphia Inquirer of Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.  From a leather bound album of 21 8 x 10 photos of the Trumans attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.  Gift of Walter Annenberg.

title: Aftermath of atomic bomb blast, Nagasaki, Japan
Scopenote: Japanese family camps in ruins of Nagasaki, having built temporary shelter from bits of metal and wood debris on the terraced hill that was once row on row of houses.    From scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters, U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July, 1946.

title: Portrait of Henry Harley Arnold, Air Force General
Scopenote: Color mounted portrait of General of the Air Force Henry H. Arnold (1886-1950). Commanding General, U.S. Army Air Forces, 1942-1945. Same as 58-58, but color.

title: Portrait of Chester W. Nimitz, Fleet Admiral
Scopenote: Color portrait of Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz (1885-1966), Chief of Operations 1945-1947.

title: First Cavalry Division Band in parade in Tokyo
Scopenote: Heavy tanks pass the 7th Cavalry Regimental reviewing stand outside the Imperial Palace, Tokyo, Japan as the 1st Calvary Division band plays a march.    From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: Street vendor in Tokyo, Japan
Scopenote: Anything from cigarettes to fine jewelry may be purchased from street vendors in Tokyo, Japan.    From:  Scrapbook presented to Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946

title: Kegon Waterfall at Nikko, Japan
Scopenote: In a roaring cascade of silvery foam, tons of water drop some 300 feet at the Kegon Waterfall at Nikko, Japan, as soldiers watch.      From a Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946

title: Color portrait of William F. Halsey, Fleet Admiral
Scopenote: Color photo of Fleet Admiral William F. Halsey (1882-1959), Commander, United States Third Fleet, 1944-1945.

title: Nio-Mon Gate at one of the many Japanese Shrines at Nikko, Japan
Scopenote: Nio-Mon gate at one of the many Japanese shrines at Nikko, Japan.    From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: Informal Portrait of Margaret Ellen Noland as Elderly Lady
Scopenote: Informal portrait of Margaret Ellen Truman Noland, aunt of Harry S. Truman, in her living room at 216 North Delaware, Independence, Missouri.  Mrs. Noland is 96 years old in this photo.

title: Color portrait of Douglas A. MacArthur, Army General
Scopenote: Color portrait of General of the Army Douglas A. MacArthur, (1880-1964), Commander-in-Chief, United Nations Command, Korea, 1950-1951.

title: Portrait of George C. Marshall, Army General
Scopenote: Color portrait of General of the Army George C. Marshall (1880-1959), Chief of Staff, United States Army, 1939-1945. Same as 58-56, but color.

title: General Douglas MacArthur Addresses the First Council Meeting in Tokyo
Scopenote: General Douglas MacArthur addresses representatives of Great Britain, Russia and China at the first Council meeting in Tokyo, Japan.  From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: Bombed areas of Tokyo, Japan
Scopenote: Even the brick and re-enforced concrete structures were not immune to the B-29 bombings in Tokyo, Japan.    From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: View of the Mountains in Nikko, Japan, Famous for its Shrines
Scopenote: Typical of Japan's scenic beauty is this view of the mountains in vicinity of Nikko, Japan, famous for its shrines. From: Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U.S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: View inside Japanese shrine at Nikko, Japan
Scopenote: View inside Japanese shrine at Nikko, Japan.    From a  scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946

title: Portrait of Dwight D. Eisenhower, Army General
Scopenote: Color portrait of General of the Army Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), Supreme Commander, Allied Powers, Europe, 1950-1952. Same as 58-54 but color.

title: Photo of Tokyo Rose
Scopenote: The woman behind the voice and program that lightened the weary hours of many a G.I., Tokyo Rose. Her real name is Iva Toguri D'Aquino. She was born in Los Angeles, but claims to be Portuguese by marriage. This includes a duplicate photo and negative. From: A scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters, U.S. Army Forces, Pacific, in Tokyo, Japan, July, 1946.

title: Robert E. Hannegan is Speaking at Table with Sam Rayburn, Eleanor Roosevelt, and Henry Wallace
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan is shown speaking before a group during a dinner.  Shown left to right at the head table are Sam Rayburn, Eleanor Roosevelt, Robert E. Hannegan, Henry Wallace.

title: A Building on the Grounds of the 27th General Hospital, a Former Japanese Hospital
Scopenote: A building on the grounds of the 27th General Hospital, a former Japanese hospital, now being operated by the Occupation Forces.  In the foreground a formal Japanese garden can be seen.    From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: A Former Japanese Hospital, Now Being Operated by the Occupation Forces
Scopenote: One of the buildings at the 27th General Hospital, a former Japanese hospital, now being operated by the Occupation Forces.    From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: Here for centuries have flocked the faithful to pray to ancient deities at the Toshogu Shrine in Nikko, Japan
Scopenote: Here for centuries have flocked the faithful to pray to ancient deities at the Toshogu Shrine in Nikko, Japan. From a scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: Vivian Truman, brother of President Truman, on his farm near Grandview, Missouri
Scopenote: Vivian Truman, brother of President Truman, on his farm near Grandview, Missouri.  Vivian Truman is dressed in work clothes and holding a piglet.

title: Truman and others leaving the White House after a meeting with President Roosevelt
Scopenote: From left to right Vice President Henry A. Wallace, Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, Senate Majority Leader Alben Barkley, Vice President-elect Harry S. Truman, and House Majority Leader John McCormack leaving the White House after a meeting with President Franklin D. Roosevelt.

title: Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan Reading the Newspaper in his Office
Scopenote: Close up of Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan reading the newspaper in his office. The newspaper headlines are about an anti-strike bill forced on the floor by a House vote. There is a bookcase in the background.

title: President Truman and Secretary of War Mobilization Fred M. Vinson walking in the White House Rose Garden
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Secretary of War Mobilization Fred M. Vinson walking in the White House Rose Garden.

title: Exterior view of the Truman apartment at 4701 Connecticut Avenue in Washington, D. C
Scopenote: Exterior view of the Truman apartment at 4701 Connecticut Avenue in Washington, D. C.  Capital police are shown on guard around the building where the new President and Mrs. Truman reside until they move into the White House.

title: Vice President Truman's office in the Senate Office Building in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman's office in the Senate Office Building in Washington, D.C.  Many family pictures are shown on the walls and mantel of the room.  Vice President Truman is not in the picture.

title: President Truman and General Mark W. Clark in the Executive Office of the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and General Mark W. Clark in the Executive Office of the White House.

title: U. S. Naval Hospital at the U. S. Marine Corps Training Base, Quantico, Virginia
Scopenote: U. S. Naval Hospital at the U. S. Marine Corps Training Base, Quantico, Virginia.    From a leather bound album of 55 8 x 10 photos taken during President Truman's trip to the Marine Training Base. Gift from Lemuel C. Shepherd, Jr., Major General, U. S. Marine Corps, Commandant, Marine Training Schools.

title: President Truman signing the guest register at the Paradise Inn Hotel in Mount Rainier National Park
Scopenote: President Truman signing the guest register at the Paradise Inn Hotel in Mount Rainier National Park.  He is outside, and snow is shown all around the President.  This is an International News Photo by Hack Miller, published by Life Magazine.

title: President Truman pins the star of a Brigadier General on the shoulder of his military aide, Harry H. Vaughan of St. Louis, Missouri
Scopenote: President Truman pins the star of a Brigadier General on the shoulder of his military aide, Harry H. Vaughan of St. Louis, Missouri. Photo similar to 89-71.

title: Ricksha's line up outside the American Red Cross Banker's Club in Tokyo
Scopenote: Ricksha's line up outside the American Red Cross Banker's Club, a popular G.I. recreation center, to take sightseers to the various points of interest in Tokyo, Japan.    From: From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: Hiroshima in ruins
Scopenote: Hiroshima on Honshu Island lies in ruins as a result of August, 1945 atomic bombing that hastened Japanese capitulation.    From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: View of the Mitsubishi Torpedo Plant in Nagasaki, following the atomic bomb explosion
Scopenote: Nagasaki's Mitsubishi Torpedo Plant, said to be the world's largest, following the atomic bomb explosion. From: Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U.S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: Aerial view of Hiroshima after atomic bomb blast
Scopenote: Aerial view of Hiroshima depicts the terrific destructive force of the atomic bomb.  This includes a duplicate photo and negative.  From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: Hiroshima in ruins
Scopenote: Another view of Hiroshima, showing devastation caused by first atomic bomb dropped on Japan in August, 1945.  This includes a duplicate photo and negative.  From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: President Truman with his Cabinet
Scopenote: President Truman with his cabinet during a meeting in the Cabinet Room.

title: President Truman Presents the Legion of Merit to General De Gaulle
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes the hand of General Charles De Gaulle after presenting the Legion of Merit with accompanying degree of Chief Commander to the General. General Harry Vaughan is shown in the background (center). This is similar to 89-86.

title: General MacArthur arrives at Atsugi Airfield
Scopenote: General Douglas MacArthur, Supreme Commander, arrives at Atsugi Airfield in Japan. From: Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946. [These photographs have also been reproduced in 8x10 and are in the regular photo boxes.]

title: Still under construction is a stone Buddha started 14 years ago in Japan
Scopenote: Still under construction is a stone Buddha started 14 years ago, in Japan.     From a Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946

title: Shrine of Toshogu at Nikko, Japan
Scopenote: The original three monkeys, "See no evil, Speak no evil, and Hear no evil," decorate the Shrine of Toshogu at Nikko, Japan. From a scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: Japanese bell ringer is shown ringing one of the big bells at the shrines at Nikko, Japan
Scopenote: Japanese bell ringer is shown ringing one of the big bells at the Toshogu shrine at Nikko, Japan.    From a scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946

title: Dancers complete intricate pantomime in Japan
Scopenote: Japanese dancers complete intricate pantomime. These are not Geisha girls, who serve guests and dance...these are professional dancers whose kimonos are worth a small fortune. They dance on mats with white socks for slippers. From a Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: View of the walk which leads up to the first entrance to the Toshogu Shrine in Nikko, Japan
Scopenote: View of the walk which leads up to the first entrance to the Toshogu Shrine in Nikko, Japan.    From a scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: Shrines as seen at Toshogu Shrine, Nikko, Japan
Scopenote: One of the finest examples of intricate ornamentation commonly found on shrines as seen at Toshogu Shrine, Nikko, Japan.    From a scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: Japanese entertainers, supported by wailing string quartet, perform famed "Lion Dance," at a dinner party
Scopenote: Japanese entertainers, supported by wailing string quartet, perform famed "Lion Dance," at a dinner party.    From a scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: Admiral Chester W. Nimitz Signs the Japanese Surrender for the United States
Scopenote: Admiral Chester W. Nimitz (seated) is signing the Allied Surrender Terms agreement which finalized the unconditional surrender of the Japanese and the end of the war with Japan. Behind Admiral Nimitz are (left to right) General Douglas MacArthur, Admiral William F. Halsey and Rear Admiral Forrest Sherman.  Other soldiers and sailors in the background are unidentified. The ceremony took place aboard the USS Missouri. This includes a duplicate photo and negative. From a Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July, 1946.

title: Army and Navy planes fly over U.S.S. Missouri at the conclusion of surrender ceremonies
Scopenote: Army and Navy planes fly over U.S.S. Missouri at the conclusion of the Japanese surrender ceremonies.    From a scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters, U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: General MacArthur and his personal staff live in the American Embassy in Tokyo, Japan
Scopenote: General Douglas MacArthur and his personal staff live in the American Embassy in Tokyo, Japan, formerly occupied by Ambassador Joseph C. Grew. From a Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946. (These photographs were also reproduced in 8x10 size and placed in the regular photo boxes).

title: Yokohama new Grand Hotel, guarded by 11th Airborne Division, was for the Supreme Commander and United Nations Signatories during preparation for ceremony
Scopenote: Yokohama (Japan) new Grand Hotel, guarded by 11th Airborne Division, was for the Supreme Commander and United Nations Signatories during preparation for ceremony.    From a scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: General MacArthur greets Gen. Jonathan Wainwright
Scopenote: General Douglas MacArthur greets General Jonathan Wainwright in Yokohama's new Grand Hotel.  This is their first meeting since they parted in embattled Corregidor, in the Philippines, in 1942.    From a Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters, U. S. Army Forces, Pacific, in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.  (These photographs were also reproduced in 8x10 and placed in the regular photo boxes).

title: Surrender of Japan Ceremonies Aboard the USS Missouri
Scopenote: Lieutenant General Kuzma Nikolaevich Derevyanko of the Soviet Union (seated) signs the Instrument of Surrender for Japan during ceremonies on board the USS Missouri. Standing in the foreground on the left is United States General Douglas MacArthur. All others are unidentified.  From a scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters, U. S. Army Forces, Pacific, in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: Supreme Commander Douglas MacArthur signs Japanese Surrender on U.S.S. Missouri
Scopenote: Supreme Commander MacArthur seals Japanese defeat as Generals Jonathan Wainwright and Percival of Singapore stand by. In center of Officers in background is Admiral William "Bull" Halsey. On the right Generals George C. Spaatz and Kenney of the Air Forces. Sixth from the right, front row, is Capt. John D. Gingrich. The signing took place aboard the battleship Missouri. This includes a duplicate photo and a negative.

title: Foreign Minister Shigemitsu Signs Surrender Terms on U.S.S. Missouri
Scopenote: Japanese Foreign Minister Mamoru Shigemitsu signs surrender terms while General Richard K. Sutherland looks on.  The signing took place on the battleship U.S.S. Missouri.     From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946

title: A Japanese Delegation Arrives at the U.S.S. Missouri to Sign the Surrender of Japan
Scopenote: A Japanese delegation, headed by Foreign Minister Mamoru Shigemitsu and General Yoshijiro Umezu, arrive at the U.S.S. Missouri in Tokyo Bay to sign the surrender of Japan.   From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.

title: American Flag is hoisted in Seoul, Korea
Scopenote: Officers and men of the 24th Corps stand at attention as the American Flag is hoisted in Seoul, Korea, September 9, 1945.    From a scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters, U. S. Army Forces, Pacific, in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.  (These photographs have been reproduced in 8x10 and placed in the regular photo boxes).

title: The Japanese flag is hauled down at Seoul, Korea
Scopenote: The Japanese flag is hauled down at Seoul, Korea, as the rising sun sets in the far east...the end of Dai Nippon.    From a scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters, U. S. Army Forces, Pacific, in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.  (These photographs are also reproduced in 8x10 and placed in the regular photo boxes).

title: Koreans out to witness formal surrender of the Japanese in Seoul
Scopenote: On September 9, 1945, Korea turned out to witness the formal surrender of the Japanese in Seoul, the Capital.      From a scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters, U. S. Army Forces, Pacific, in Tokyo, Japan, July 1946.  (These photographs were reproduced in 8x10 and have been placed in regular photo boxes).

title: Ex-Prime Minister Tojo after an attempted suicide
Scopenote: Photo of Ex-Prime Minister Tojo after an attempted suicide.  Tojo will be tried before International Military Tribunal for the Far East.  This photo includes a duplicate and a negative.  From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific, in Tokyo, Japan, July, 1946.

title: Helen Traubel signs Margaret Truman's program at the opening of the Metropolitan Opera's 61st season
Scopenote: Helen Traubel, who sang the part of Elsa of Brabant in Lohengrin, signs Margaret Truman's program at the opening of the Metropolitan Opera's 61st season. From a leather bound album "Opening Night."

title: Helen Traubel in opera costume
Scopenote: Portrait of Helen Traubel, soprano, who performed the part of Elsa of Brabant in Lohengrin during the 61st season opening of the Metropolitan Opera in New York City. Bess and Margaret Truman attended the performance.  From a leather bound album "Opening Night."

title: President Truman greeting Prime Minister Clement Attlee at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) greeting Prime Minister Clement Attlee of England upon his arrival at the White House.  Mr. Attlee is in the U.S. to discuss the problem of atomic energy with the President.

title: President Truman and the Right Reverend Hewlett Johnson
Scopenote: President Truman and the Right Reverend Hewlett Johnson, Dean of Canterbury, are shown seated together during a meeting in the oval office at the White House.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman Arrive at the Metropolitan Opera
Scopenote: Bess and Margaret Truman arrive at the Metropolitan Opera in New York City for the opening of the 61st season.  This was the first time a First Lady had attended a Metropolitan opening.   From a leather bound album "Opening Night."

title: Margaret Truman and Unidentified Men at Dinner
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (center) and unidentified men are seated at dinner preceding the 61st season opening of the Metropolitan Opera in New York City.   From a leather bound album "Opening Night."

title: Philadelphia Inquirer artist rendering of an Army-Navy game Football poster by Gib Crockett
Scopenote: Philadelphia Inquirer artist rendering of an Army-Navy game Football poster by Gib Crockett.    From a leather bound album of 21 8x10 photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia. Gift of Walter Annenberg.

title: President Harry S. Truman attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaving the game upon its completion. Admirals William Leahy and Ernest King look on. The President spent the first half of the game in an Army box seat and the second half in the Navy stands.  From a leather bound album of photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.

title: President Harry S. Truman leaving after attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) surrounded by reporters as he leaves the game upon its completion, accompanied by Admiral Ernest King (to the right of President Truman).  The President spent the first half of the game in an Army box seat and the second half in the Navy stands.  From a leather bound album of photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.

title: President Truman leaving the Army-Navy football game in 1945 with Admiral Leahy and Admiral King
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaving the Army-Navy football game in 1945 with Admiral Ernest J. King (to the left of Mr. Truman) and Admiral William Leahy (to the right of Mr. Truman).   From:  A leather bound album of 21 8 x 10 photos of the Trumans attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945. Gift of Walter Annenberg.

title: The Truman's attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945
Scopenote: The Truman's (Harry, Bess, and Margaret) attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.  From:  A leather bound album of 21 8 x 10 photos of the Trumans attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945. A gift of Walter Annenberg.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Family at the Army-Navy Football Fame
Scopenote: A smiling President Harry S. Truman waves to spectators while holding the arm of Margaret Truman who is standing next to Bess Truman attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.  From a leather bound album of photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman tipping his hat to spectators as he stands with Margaret Truman and Bess Truman.  From a leather bound album of photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.

title: Philadelphia football stadium during the Army-Navy game in 1945
Scopenote: Philadelphia football stadium during the Army-Navy game in 1945. This is a view from the stands from an end zone.   From a leather bound album photo of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia. Gift of Walter Annenberg.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman upon arrival by train to attend the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shown following Bess Truman down the train stairs. The conductor is shown at left.  From a leather bound album of 21 photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman and other men walk away from the train station upon arrival in Philadelphia
Scopenote: A smiling President Harry S. Truman walks with Bess Truman and other men away from the train station upon arrival in Philadelphia.  From a leather bound album of photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia.

title: President Harry S. Truman waving to spectators at the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945 as Bess Truman and Margaret Truman look on
Scopenote: A smiling President Harry S. Truman waves to spectators with Bess Truman sitting to his left, Admiral William Leahy (partially obscured) to his right. Margaret Truman also attending the game  sits behind her mother.  From a leather bound album of photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) waving his hat as he sits with Admiral William Leahy, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman behind them.  From a leather bound album of photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.

title: Various photos featured in the Philadelphia Inquirer of the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945
Scopenote: Collage of various photos featured in the Philadelphia Inquirer of the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945. President Harry S. Truman is included in photographs.  From:  A leather bound album of 21 8 x 10 photos of the Trumans attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945. Gift of Walter Annenberg.

title: President Harry S. Truman motorcade to the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945
Scopenote: President Harry S. Trumans' motorcade in a convertible to the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.  From a leather bound album of photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia.

title: President Harry S. Truman motorcade to the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945
Scopenote: President Harry S. Trumans' motorcade in a convertible to the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.  From a leather bound album of photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia.

title: President Harry S. Truman motorcade to the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945
Scopenote: From a leather bound album of photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia. President Harry S. Trumans' motorcade in a convertible to the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) waving his hat to spectators as he sits with Admiral William Leahy (left), Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman behind them.  From a leather bound album of photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.

title: President Harry S. Truman standing and waving from back of car in motorcade to the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman standing and waving from back of a car in a motorcade to the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia. Admiral William Leahy, Bess Truman can be seen seated in the car. Admiral Ernest J. King can be seen at right.  From a leather bound album of photos of the Trumans attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) sitting with Admiral William Leahy, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman (face obscured) at the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia.  From a leather bound album of photos of the Trumans' attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945.

title: Photo of Harry, Bess and Margaret Truman attending the 1945 Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia as it appeared on the front page of the Philadelphia Inquirer on December 2, 1945
Scopenote: Photo of Harry, Bess and Margaret Truman attending the 1945 Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia as it appeared on the front page of the Philadelphia Inquirer on December 2, 1945. From: A leather bound album of 21 8 x 10 photos of the Trumans attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia in 1945. Gift of Walter Annenberg.

title: General Tojo and other alleged Japanese war criminals arrive at the War Ministry Building for their arraignment
Scopenote: General Tojo and other alleged Japanese war criminals arrive at the War Ministry Building for their arraignment. This includes a duplicate photo and negative. From: Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific, in Tokyo, Japan, July, 1946.

title: Paul H. Griffith shown with unidentified man
Scopenote: Commander of the American Legion Paul H. Griffith (left) shown with unidentified man.

title: American Legion National Commander Paul H. Griffith Speaking
Scopenote: American Legion National Commander Paul H. Griffith speaking as one unidentified man takes notes and two others look on.

title: American Legion National Commander Paul H. Griffith Shown with Legion Members
Scopenote: American Legion National Commander Paul H. Griffith (center) shown with unidentified Legion members.

title: President Truman and Paul H. Griffith in Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) and American Legion Commander Paul H. Griffith (left)  shown with two unidentified men.

title: The justices of the International Military Tribunal for the Far East
Scopenote: The Justices of the International Military Tribunal for the Far East at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.  This includes a duplicate photo and negative.  From: Scrapbook presented Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific, in Tokyo, Japan, July, 1946.

title: Ex-Prime Minister Hideki Tojo and his attorney, Capt. Beverly Coleman
Scopenote: Hideki Tojo chats with his attorney, Captain Beverly Coleman, Chief Defense Council, before arraignment at the War Crimes Trial in Tokyo.  This includes a duplicate photo and negative.  From:  Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters U. S. Army Forces, Pacific, in Tokyo, Japan, July, 1946.

title: Photo of Marching Band and Banner Displaying Paul H. Griffith's Name
Scopenote: Photo of marching band and banner displaying Paul H. Griffith's name. This appears to be a campaign for him to be National Commander of the American Legion.

title: American Legion National Commander Paul H. Griffith Shown with Members of the Legion
Scopenote: American Legion National Commander Paul H. Griffith (third from left) shown with five unidentified members of the Legion.

title: American Legion National Commander Paul H. Griffith Signing Autographs
Scopenote: American Legion National Commander Paul H. Griffith signing autographs for unidentified persons.

title: American Legion National Commander Paul H. Griffith with Man
Scopenote: American Legion National Commander Paul H. Griffith (left) shown with unidentified Legionnaire.

title: Photo of Colonel Kingoro Hashimoto
Scopenote: Colonel Kingoro Hashimoto of the Black Dragon Society and Points Far East. He was charged with ordering an attack on a U.S. gunboat. This includes a negative and duplicate photo. From: A Scrapbook presented to Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan on the occasion of his visit to General Headquarters, U. S. Army Forces Pacific, in Tokyo, Japan, July, 1946.

title: Robert E. Hannegan, Postmaster General, and Chief Justice Fred Vinson, is shown with a group of eight men at a speakers podium

title: Formal photo of President Truman and his Cabinet seated at conference table

Scopenote: President Truman before the Grandview, Missouri home of his mother.  The President is bringing gifts and flowers to his 97 year old mother who has suffered a fractured hip.

title: President Harry S. Truman and James P. Finnegan in East St. Louis
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at microphones) addressing crowd in East St. Louis, Illinois, from the rear of his campaign train. James P. Finnegan is to the right of the President. Same as 66-775. From: The album The President's Trip to the West Coast of the United States.

title: President Truman at a Whistlestop in Baltimore
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is introduced to the crowd at the train station in Baltimore, Maryland, by an unidentified man. Matthew Connelly leans against the rail next to the President. Secret Service agent Roy Kellerman stands at right in foreground (hands on hips). This stop was during the western trip in 1948. From: Album from Capt. Robert Dennison, U.S. Navy.

title: President Truman and Captain Robert Dennison at Union Station, Kansas City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Captain Robert Dennison shakes hands with unidentified people upon their arrival at Union Station in Kansas City, Missouri.   From:  Album from Capt. Robert Dennison, U.S. Navy.

title: President Truman, Bess Truman and Margaret Truman wave from the back platform of their train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman wave from the back platform of their train before leaving for Philadelphia for the Democratic convention.  This is the same as 68-1949 and 92-71, but is better quality.

title: Floodlights at Gilmore Stadium in Los Angeles during the 1948 Presidential Campaign
Scopenote: Floodlights at Gilmore Stadium in Los Angeles during the 1948 Presidential Campaign. President Harry S. Truman spoke at this stadium.

title: Truman whistlestop in California
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves after being presented with a pinata on the whistlestop in California.  James Roosevelt, son of President Franklin D. Roosevelt, is at the right in this photo.

title: President and Mrs. Truman on the rear platform of their Whistlestop train during stop
Scopenote: President and Mrs. Harry S. Truman on the rear platform of their Whistlestop train during an unidentified stop in Texas or New Mexico.  Mrs. Bess Truman waves to the crowd. Other dignitaries are on the platform with the Truman's. There is a sign on the train for the Mutual Broadcasting System, KFXJ.

title: Senator J. Howard McGrath and William Boyle greeted at Airport by Admiral Dennison
Scopenote: Senator J. Howard McGrath (third from left) and William Boyle being greeted upon their arrival at the airport by Admiral Robert Dennison (second from left) and unidentified officer.  Same as 66-911.  Album from Admiral Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: Senator Alben Barkley, Leslie Biffle and Captain Robert L. Dennison in open car, Key West
Scopenote: Left to right:  Senator Alben Barkley, Leslie Biffle and Captain Robert L. Dennison in an open car on their way to the Little White House in Key West, Florida. Same as 2012-43.  Album from Captain Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: President Truman Leaving the Sacred Cow upon Arrival at Boca Chica
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaving the presidential airplane Sacred Cow upon arrival at Boca Chica, Florida.  Captain Cecil Adell greets the President.  From:  Album from Capt. Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: Senator Alben Barkley arrives at Boca Chica, Florida
Scopenote: Senator Alben Barkley alights from a Navy aircraft at Boca Chica, Florida, for a meeting with President Harry S. Truman. Same as 2012-35.  From:  Album from Captain Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: Senator J. Howard McGrath , William Boyle, President Truman, Eben Ayers and Admiral Robert L. Dennison in Key West
Scopenote: Left to right:  Admiral Robert Dennison, Senator J. Howard McGrath, President Harry S. Truman, William Boyle, and Assistant Press Secretary Eben Ayers at the door of the Little White House in Key West, Florida.  Same as 66-912.  Album from Capt. Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: President Truman (back to camera) on the Beach with Eben Ayers and Unidentified Man
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) on the beach with Assistant Press Secretary Eben Ayers (dark glasses) and unidentified man.  Same as 66-909.  From:  Album from Captain Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: President Truman and Secretary of Defense James Forrestal on the Lawn of the Little White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Secretary of Defense James Forrestal on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida.  From:  Album from Captain Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: Presidential Party at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Group photo of the Presidential party at Key West, Florida.  Left to right back row:  Donald Dawson, Eben Ayers, General Robert Landry, General Harry Vaughan, Unidentified, Clark Clifford, Stanley Woodward, General Wallace Graham, Admiral Robert L. Dennison and two unidentified men. Front row:  Bill Hassett, Alben Barkley, President Harry S. Truman, Admiral William Leahy and John Steelman.  Same as 66-910.  From:  Album from Captain Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: Governor Mon Wallgren and David Niles at the Little White House in Key West
Scopenote: Left to right:  David K. Niles and Governor Mon Wallgren at the Little White House in Key West, Florida.  From:  Album from Capt. Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: President Truman Inspecting Marine Guard at the Little White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman informally inspecting the Marine guard at the Little White House in Key West, Florida.  Same as 66-933.  From:  Album from Capt. Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: Stuart Symington, President Truman, and Mon Wallgren at the Little White House, Key West
Scopenote: Left to right:  Clark Clifford, Senator Stuart Symington, President Harry S. Truman, and Governor (of Washington) Mon Wallgren at the Little White House, Key West, Florida. Same as photo 66-926.  From:  Album from Captain Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: Truman Family Visit Fort Jefferson National Monument
Scopenote: The Truman family (Harry, Bess, and Margaret) visit Fort Jefferson National Monument, in the Dry Tortugas off Key West, Florida. Mrs. Truman and Margaret are shown with John Steelman (second from left in white hat), Stanley Woodward (behind President with no hat), Admiral William Leahy (far right) and Leslie Biffle in front of Mrs. Truman. From: album from Captain Robert L. Dennison.

title: The Williamsburg Entering Havana Harbor in 1948
Scopenote: The presidential yacht Williamsburg entering Havana harbor in Cuba in 1948.  From:  Album from Capt. Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: The Williamsburg in Key West Naval Station
Scopenote: The Williamsburg at her berth in Key West Naval Station.  Same as 66-920.  From:  Album from Capt. Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: Presidential Party Greets Matthew Connelly and Charlie Ross on Their Arrival in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and the presidential party turns out to greet Appointments Secretary Matthew Connelly and Press Secretary Charles Ross (at left) on their arrival in Key West, Florida, where President Truman in vacationing.  From:  Album from Capt. Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: Crowd outside the Truman home on Delaware Street in Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Crowd outside the Truman home on Delaware Street in Independence, Missouri.  This was apparently a Life Magazine photo purchased from a local photographer.

title: Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul H. Griffith shown displaying award with two unidentified men
Scopenote: Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul H. Griffith  (center) shown displaying award with two unidentified men, one in military uniform.

title: Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul Griffith is shown with unidentified men in Rome, Italy
Scopenote: Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul Griffith is shown with unidentified men in Rome, Italy.

title: Paul H. Griffith by airplane
Scopenote: Paul H. Griffith, Assistant Secretary of Defense, stands by a National Airlines airplane with unidentified man.  Mr. Griffith is at right.

title: Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul Griffith shown with unidentified military men in Paris, France
Scopenote: Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul Griffith shown with unidentified military men in Paris, France.

title: Photo of Four Chaplains Memorial Swimming Pool, Bronx Veterans Hospital
Scopenote: Photo of Four Chaplains Memorial Swimming Pool, Bronx Veterans Hospital.  Swimmers are in the pool with a crowd surrounding it.
Institutional Creator: Standard Flashlight Co., Inc., New York

title: President Harry Truman at the Knowles Memorial Chapel, Rollins College
Scopenote: President Harry Truman at the Knowles Memorial Chapel, Rollins College, in Florida.  He is surrounded by choir members.  From:  Album from Rear Adm. Robert L. Dennison.

title: The Williamsburg Approaching Frederiksted, St. Croix, Virgin Islands
Scopenote: The Williamsburg approaching anchorage at Frederiksted, St. Croix, Virgin Islands. Sailors are lined up on the deck. From: Album from Capt. Robert L. Dennison, USN.

title: Dining room in Little White House in Key West
Scopenote: Dining room in Little White House in Key West, Florida.  From:  Album from Rear Adm. Robert L. Dennison.

title: South porch of the Little White House in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: South porch of the Little White House in Key West, Florida.  From:  Album from Rear Adm. Robert L. Dennison.

title: President Truman waving from automobile in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waving from automobile, accompanied by unidentified Naval officers in Key West, Florida.  From:  Album from Rear Adm. Robert L. Dennison.

title: President Truman and General Vaughan Leaving Washington National Airport for Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and General Harry Vaughan (in uniform) leaving Washington National Airport for Key West, Florida.  From:  Album from Rear Adm. Robert L. Dennison.

title: President Truman and General Vaughan Boarding Airplane to Leave Washington for Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and General Harry Vaughan boarding the Independence to leave from Washington for Key West, Florida.  From:  Album from Rear Adm. Robert L. Dennison.

title: President Truman and Admiral Leahy in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Admiral William Leahy in Key West, Florida.  From: Album from Rear Adm. Robert L. Dennison.

title: President Truman with Admiral Leahy and Admiral Dennison
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman walking with Admiral William Leahy and Admiral Robert Dennison.  They appear to be at the Boca Chica airport, enroute to Key West, Florida.  From:  Album from Rear Adm. Robert L. Dennison.

title: President's Bedroom in Little White House in Key West
Scopenote: The President's bedroom in the Little White House in Key West, Florida.  From an album from Rear Adm. Robert L. Dennison.

title: Welcoming Ceremony at the Air Force Base, Orlando, Florida
Scopenote: Welcoming ceremony at the Air Force Base, Orlando, Florida. President Harry S. Truman (back to camera) is shaking hands with unidentified man. Gov. Fuller Warren of Florida is standing by President Truman, holding hat.  From:  Album from Rear Adm. Robert L. Dennison.

title: The Truman Commemorative Stone at Rollins College
Scopenote: The Truman commemorative stone at Rollins College in Florida.  President Harry S. Truman visited the college to receive an honorary degree.  From:  Album gift from Rear Adm. Robert L. Dennison.

title: President Truman, Dr. Hamilton Holt and Governor Fuller Warren Enroute to Winter Park, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Dr. Hamilton Holt and Governor Fuller Warren enroute in car to Winter Park, Florida.  From:  Album from rear Adm Robert L. Dennison.

title: President Truman Inspects the Guard of Honor, Orlando Air Force Base
Scopenote: Before departing, the President inspects the Guard of Honor, Orlando Air Force Base.  Officers unidentified.  Album gift from Rear Adm. Robert L. Dennison.

title: Admiral Robert L. Dennison greeting Chief Justice Fred Vinson at the Boca Chica  Airport
Scopenote: Admiral Robert L. Dennison (right side of photo) greeting Chief Justice Fred Vinson at the Boca Chica, Florida airport.  Others unidentified.  Mr. Vinson has arrived to join President Truman at Key West.  From:  Album, a gift from Rear Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: President Truman with his Fishing Party Being Interviewed by the Press
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (head turned, center) shown with his fishing party, being interviewed by the press.  Robert Dennison and Robert Landry are next to President Truman.  From:  Album gift from Rear Adm. Robert L. Dennison.

title: President Truman, Stanley Woodward and John Steelman walk to Truman Beach
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Stanley Woodward, Naval officer, and John Steelman walk to Truman Beach.  Others unidentified.  Same as 66-854.  From: Album gift from Rear Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: Formal portrait of President Truman and his Cabinet
Scopenote: Formal portrait of President Truman and his Cabinet.  Left to Right:  Louis Johnson, Dean Acheson, the President, Vice President Barkley, John Snyder, Tom Clark.  Second Row - Left to Right - Julius Krug, Jesse Donaldson, Charles Brannan, Charles Sawyer, and Maurice Tobin.

title: President Truman Attends Football Game in Virginia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is shown performing the coin toss at a football game between the Quantico Marines and Virginia Polytechnic Institute played in Alexandria, Virginia at the high school football stadium. Press Secretary Charlie Ross is seated in first row on far left.   From a leather bound album of 55 8 x 10 photos of President Truman's  visit to the Marine Corps Training Base.  Gift of Lemuel C. Shepherd, Jr., Major General, U. S. Marine Corps, Commandant, Marine Corps Schools.

Scopenote: Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul Griffith arriving at the Infantry School, Fort Benning, Georgia, for the Joint Orientation Conference.

title: Portrait of Prince Bernhard of the Netherlands
Scopenote: Nice portrait of His Royal Highness Prince Bernhard of the Netherlands, who is chairman of the board of Sea Sciences Corporation.

title: Portrait of Omar N. Bradley, Army General
Scopenote: Color portrait of General of the Army Omar N. Bradley (1893-1981), Chairman, United States Joint Chiefs of Staff, 1950-1953. Same as 58-59, but color.  Original portrait is in oversize drawer.

title: Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson and Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul H. Griffith
Scopenote: Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson is shown speaking at a podium in front of a huge portrait of himself, while Assistant Secretary of Defense and Past National American Legion Commander Paul H. Griffith reaches for something on the podium. The man on the far right is not identified.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul H. Griffith and two unidentified men in the Oval Office
Scopenote: Left to right:  Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul H. Griffith, President Harry S. Truman, and two unidentified men in the Oval Office.

title: Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul H. Griffith
Scopenote: Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul H. Griffith.

title: Paul H. Griffith shown with an etched  portrait of President Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: Paul H. Griffith, Assistant Secretary of Defense, shown with a portrait of President Franklin D. Roosevelt which appears to be etched in marble.

title: Matthew Connelly, Louis Johnson and Charles Ross at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Appointments Secretary Matthew Connelly, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson and Press Secretary Charles Ross at Key West, Florida. They are vacationing with President Truman in Key West.  Same as 66-867.  From:  Album gift from Rear Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul H. Griffith  at the Municipal Airport, Reading, Pennsylvania
Scopenote: Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul H. Griffith is shown at the Municipal Airport, Reading, Pennsylvania, with others not identified.  Griffith is the fourth from the left.

title: Bess Truman Boarding the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: Bess Truman boarding the U.S.S. Williamsburg. President Harry S. Truman is behind her.  They are en route to Key West, Florida.  From:  Album gift from Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: The Escort Ship Lenore is Detached from the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: The escort ship Lenore is detached from the U.S.S. Williamsburg.  This is the same as 66-841.  From:  Album, gift from Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: The U.S.S. Williamsburg encounters heavy seas off the North Carolina coast
Scopenote: The U.S.S. Williamsburg encounters heavy seas off the North Carolina coast. Same as 66-843.

title: President Truman Aboard the U.S.S. Williamsburg with Rear Admiral Robert Dennison, Charles Ross  and Charles Murphy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman seated aboard the U.S.S. Williamsburg.  Left to right:  Charles Murphy, President Truman, Rear Admiral Robert Dennison, and Press Secretary Charles Ross. They are on a trip to Key West, Florida. Same as 66-845.  From:  Album gift from Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: The Presidential dining room aboard the presidential yacht Williamsburg
Scopenote: The Presidential dining room aboard the presidential yacht Williamsburg.  From:  Album gift from Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: Rear Admiral Robert Dennison greets Chief Justice Fred Vinson and Clark Clifford upon arrival at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Robert Dennison (left) greets Chief Justice Fred Vinson (center) and Clark Clifford upon their arrival at Key West, Florida where they will join President Truman.  From:  Album, gift from Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison.

title: Presidential staff playing volleyball at the Truman Beach
Scopenote: Presidential staff playing volleyball at the Truman Beach in Key West, Florida.  Same as 66-852.  From:  Album gift from Rear Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: Volleyball game on Truman Beach at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Truman staff participate in volleyball game on Truman Beach at Key West, Florida.  From:  Album from Rear Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: Margaret Truman participates in volleyball game at Key West
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (second from left) participates in a volleyball game with Truman staff on the Truman Beach at Key West, Florida.  Same as 66-882.  From:  Album from Rear Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: Shown aboard the submarine Corporal are Admiral Robert Dennison, Secretary J. T. Koehler, William Hassett, Charles Murphy, Stanley Woodward and others
Scopenote: Shown aboard the submarine Corporal are, left to right, Admiral Robert Dennison, Secretary J. T. Koehler, William Hassett (partially obscured), Charles Murphy, two unidentified men, Stanley Woodward and unidentified others.  From:  Album from Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: Aboard the submarine Corporal are Secretary J.T. Koehler, Admiral Robert Dennison; William Hassett and Charles Murphy
Scopenote: Aboard the submarine Corporal are Secretary J.T. Koehler, Admiral Robert Dennison; William Hassett and Charles Murphy.  From:  Album, gift from Rear Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: Lunch Aboard the Destroyer Epperson
Scopenote: Lunch being served aboard the destroyer Epperson.  Shown on the far left is William Hassett.  Assistant Secretary of the Navy John T. Koehler is served food and to his right is Stanley Woodward.  These activities happened during a visit to Key West, Florida.  From:  Album from Robert L. Dennison.

title: Aboard the submarine Corporal are:  Admiral Robert Dennison, William Hassett, Secretary J. T. Koehler, George Elsey and Charles Murphy
Scopenote: Aboard the submarine Corporal are left to right:  Admiral Robert Dennison, William Hassett (back to camera), Secretary J. T. Koehler, George Elsey (head turned) and Charles Murphy.  From:  Album gift from Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: David Stowe and Charles Ross at the Little White House in Key West, Florida

title: President Truman and Chief Justice Fred Vinson at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Chief Justice Fred Vinson at Key West, Florida.  Same as 66-857. They are at the Little White House.  From:  Album, a gift from Rear Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: David Niles, General Harry Vaughan, General Wallace Graham and William Hassett at Truman Beach
Scopenote: Left to right:  David Niles, General Harry Vaughan, General Wallace Graham and William Hassett at Truman Beach during presidential visit to Key West, Florida.  From:  Album, gift from Rear Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: Presidential staff at Key West, Florida

Scopenote: Grounds of the Infantry School, Fort Benning, Georgia.
