title: George Elsey and other members of advance party attend a planning conference at Pearl Harbor
Scopenote: George Elsey and other members of advance party attend a planning conference at Pearl Harbor in preparation for President Truman's trip to Wake Island.  From:  Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison album.

title: President Truman arrives at Hickam Field in Hawaii
Scopenote: President Truman arrives at Hickam Field in Hawaii, en route to Wake Island.  He is descending from his airplane, the Independence.  From:  Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison Album

title: Officer's Club at Kailua Beach
Scopenote: Officer's Club at Kailua Beach in Hawaii, where President Truman stopped to visit en route to Wake Island.  President Truman is not in this photograph.  From:  Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison Album

title: The Independence airplane at Hickam Field in Hawaii
Scopenote: The "Independence," President Truman's airplane,  at Hickam Field in Hawaii.  It is en route to Wake Island for the conference between President Harry S. Truman and General Douglas MacArthur.  From:  Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison Album

title: Charlie Ross briefs members of the press during trip to Wake Island
Scopenote: Charlie Ross briefs members of the press during the trip to Wake Island.  From:  Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison Album

title: View of crowd along Truman Avenue at Boca Chica, FL
Scopenote: View of crowd along Truman Avenue at Boca Chica, Florida, where President Truman landed during his arrival to vacation in Key West. From: Album gift from Rear Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: Officers awaiting the arrival of President Truman at Hickam Field in Hawaii
Scopenote: Officers awaiting the arrival of President Truman at Hickam Field in Hawaii.  President Harry S. Truman is en route to Wake Island for a conference with General Douglas MacArthur.  From:  Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison Album

title: General Omar Bradley and Admiral Arthur Radford at Hickam Field in Hawaii
Scopenote: General Omar Bradley and Admiral Arthur Radford at Hickam Field in Hawaii.  President Truman (not in photograph) has landed at Hickam Field en route to the Wake Island Conference with General Douglas MacArthur.  From:  Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison Album

title: Charles Ross announces Wake Island to be scene of conference
Scopenote: Press Secretary Charles Ross breaks the news that Wake Island is to be the scene of the conference between President Harry S. Truman and General Douglas MacArthur, at a press conference in Hawaii. From: Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison Album

title: President Truman at the Nuuanu Pali in Hawaii
Scopenote: President Truman at the Nuuanu Pali in Hawaii during a stop en route to Wake Island. From: Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison Album

title: General Omar Bradley and President Truman at the Pali
Scopenote: General Omar Bradley and President Harry S. Truman at the Pali in Hawaii. President Truman is en route to Wake Island. From: Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison Album

title: President Truman and others view blow hole during tour of Hawaii
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and others view blow hole during tour of Hawaii. President Truman is en route to Wake Island to meet with General Douglas MacArthur. From: Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison Album.

title: President Truman dining at Dixon's Chili Parlor in Kansas City, Missouri, with Fred Canfil
Scopenote: President Truman dining at Dixon's Chili Parlor in Kansas City, Missouri, with Fred Canfil (seated to President Truman's left) and other unidentified men.

title: Portrait of Truman seated at his Oval Office Desk
Scopenote: 11 x 14 color mounted to an overall size of 16 x 20 showing President Truman, seated at his desk in the Oval Office, pen in hand, looking to the right. This is a cropped version of 58-633, but is slightly superior in quality of color.

title: Photo of banquet held in Bolivia during visit by Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul Griffith
Scopenote: Photo of banquet held in Bolivia during a visit by Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul Griffith.  Following the presentation of medals to those honored Mr. Griffith, guests toast with drinks and visit.

title: The wives and honored guests watch a parade following the presentation of medals to their husbands by Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul Griffith during his visit to Bolivia
Scopenote: The wives and honored guests, with umbrellas over their heads, watch the parade following the presentation of medals to their husbands by Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul Griffith during his visit to Bolivia.

title: During a visit to Bolivia for the presentation of awards, Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul Griffith and others watch a military parade
Scopenote: During a visit to Bolivia for the presentation of awards, Assistant Secretary of Defense Paul Griffith and others watch a military parade.

title: President Truman, Gen. Vaughan, Sidney Souers and Capt. Adell leave the Little White House for a hike to Truman Beach
Scopenote: General Harry Vaughan (fifth from left), President Harry S. Truman, Adm. Sidney Souers, and Capt. C. C. Adell (far right) leave the Little White House for a hike to Truman Beach.  They are followed by 4 Secret Service agents.  From:  Album, gift from Robert Dennison.

title: Round life saver with words "Truman's Beach U. S. Naval Station."
Scopenote: Round life saver hanging on a hook with the words "Truman's Beach U. S. Naval Station."  This picture was taken on the Truman Beach at Key West, Florida.

title: Truman and staff members during press conference
Scopenote: Color mounted photo showing the President, seated, during a 3:30 press conference on the north lawn of the Little White House at Key West, Florida. The press are shown surrounding the President with members of his staff behind him including, John Steelman in light blue shirt beside military person, Joseph Feeney, just behind the President with cigarette in hand, William D. Hassett, next to Feeney, Joseph Short, next to Hassett, and Robert Dennison next to Short. From: HST estate 12/3/1974; transferred from Museum Collection 5/28/1975.

title: President Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the dinner table during the Civil Defense Conference
Scopenote: President Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the dinner table during the Civil Defense Conference.  President Truman addressed the conference later in the evening.

title: Secretary of State Dean Acheson Signing the Document During the Japanese Peace Treaty Conference
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson shown signing the document of his country in the Opera House in San Francisco during the Japanese Peace Treaty Conference.

title: Trumans greeting Princess Elizabeth and Prince Phillip, Washington Airport
Scopenote: President Truman, Bess and Margaret greeting Princess Elizabeth and Prince Phillip at the Washington Airport.  The Royal plane is in the background.

title: President Truman Leaving the Independence at Boca Chica Naval Air Station
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaving the Presidential aircraft Independence at Boca Chica Naval Air Station, FL. He is greeting officers that are lined up.  From: Album gift from Rear Admiral Robert Dennison.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) at lunch with his assistant John R. Steelman. They are in the garden of the Little White House at Key West, Florida.  From:  Album from Rear Admiral Robert Dennison.

Scopenote: Overview of the Little White House lawn at Key West, Florida, where a luncheon was held for President and Mrs. Truman and staff.  From:  Album from Rear Admiral Robert Dennison.

Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson greeting President Harry S. Truman upon his return to Washington at the Washington, D.C. airport.  President Truman had spent the holidays in Independence, Missouri.

title: President Truman Before his Address at the 1952 Democratic Party Convention
Scopenote: President Truman acknowledging the applause before his address at the 1952 Democratic Party Convention in Chicago.  His address launched the campaign of Governor Adlai Stevenson.

Scopenote: President Truman holding a copy of the Wall Street Journal on the rear platform of a train in Grand Forks, North Dakota, during the 1952 Presidential campaign.

Scopenote: President Truman with unidentified man seated in his campaign train of 1952.

title: President Truman addresses the crowd upon receiving the Franklin Roosevelt Award in Harlem, New York
Scopenote: Close up view of President Truman at podium as he addresses the crowd upon receiving the Franklin Roosevelt Award in Harlem, New York. President Truman spoke on the subject of civil rights.

title: President Truman and Margaret Truman shown with crowd in Hartford, Connecticut following President Truman's address
Scopenote: President Truman and Margaret Truman shown with crowd in Hartford, Connecticut following President Truman's address. Margaret waves to the crowd following President Truman's speech lambasting General Dwight D. Eisenhower.

title: An autographed portrait of Truman for Dean Acheson
Scopenote: 14x17 Color mounted portrait of President Truman signed on the matte "To Hon. Dean Acheson, the greatest of Secretaries of State, a man I am proud to call friend, and to have for an advisor, with kindest regards and best wishes. White House. Jan. 15, 1953, Harry S. Truman."  Portrait same as 75-1; oversized original photo is stored in vault.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman watches as Bess Truman is helped aboard a boat to go to the Marine Corps Air Station at Kaneohe Bay, Hawaii
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman watches as Bess Wallace Truman is helped aboard the boat by an unidentified Marine to go to the Marine Corps Air Station at Kaneohe Bay, Hawaii.  From a series of 25 8 x 10 photos in a leather bound album showing the Truman's as honored guests in the review and commissioning ceremony of the first provisional Marine air-ground task force, commanded by Brigadier General James P. Riseley, USMC, at the Marine Corps Air Station, Kaneohe Bay, Hawaii.

title: Overhead Photograph of Former President Truman at a Truman Committee Reunion Banquet
Scopenote: Overhead photograph of former President Harry S. Truman at an Truman Committee banquet in 1957.  Charlie Clark is seated to the left of the Mr. Truman and has signed the mounting:  To my old boss Harry S. Truman with affectionate memories of "The Old Truman Committee" Charlie Clark - 12 November 1957.  Harry Vaughan is seated in front of the President.  From the Truman estate 12/3/74, transferred from Museum Collection 5/28/75.

title: Sign and float at Tuba City Civic Center
Scopenote: Sign and float at Civic Center, Tuba City, Arizona, on occasion of chapter meeting with Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash.

title: Float advertising a Tuba City, Arizona chapter meeting with the Commissioner of Indian Affairs
Scopenote: Float advertising a chapter meeting with Philleo Nash, Commissioner of Indian Affairs, Tuba City, Arizona.

title: Philleo Nash speaking at branch of Land Operations, Bureau of Indian Affairs
Scopenote: Philleo Nash, Commissioner of Indian Affairs, speaking at branch of Land Operations for the Navajo nation, Bureau of Indian Affairs.

title: Philleo Nash is welcomed to the Tuba City Civic Center and Chapter
Scopenote: Philleo Nash, Commissioner of Indian Affairs, is welcomed to the Tuba City, Arizona Civic Center and Chapter.  Ned Natathli and Fred Haverland are shown on the far right.  Chapter officers (not named) are on the left.

title: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash Addressing the Klagetoh Meeting
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash (standing at lectern) addresses the Klagetoh meeting of the Navajo Nation on their reservation in Arizona. Annie Wauneka, Navajo tribal delegate from Klagetoh, sits in the back, center (dark shirt). The topic of the meeting was management of ranges and livestock.
Institutional Creator: Bureau of Indian Affairs; Soil and Moisture Conservation Unit Cartographic Section, Concho, OK

title: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash During the Klagetoh Meeting
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash (center, checked shirt) with unidentified man at podium during the Klagetoh meeting of the Navajo Nation on their reservation in Arizona. The meeting addressed Bureau of Indian Affairs livestock and range management policies.

title: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash with members of the Navajo Nation at Klagetoh meeting
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash (center, in checked shirt), Navajo tribal delegate from Klagetoh Annie Wauneka (center right, in dark shirt holding envelope), and area director for the Bureau of Indian Affairs Ned Haverland (center left, back row) stand with unidentified members of the Navajo Nation at the Klagetoh meeting in Arizona.
Institutional Creator: Bureau of Indian Affairs; Soil and Moisture Conservation Unit Cartographic Section, Concho, OK

title: Member of the Navajo Nation Addresses the Klagetoh Meeting
Scopenote: An unidentified member of the Navajo Nation addresses the Klagetoh meeting held at the Navajo reservation in Arizona. Navajo tribal delegate from Klagetoh Annie Wauneka (back, center, dark shirt) and Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash (right, checked shirt) listen, along with other unidentified members. The meeting discussed Bureau of Indian Affairs policies on range and livestock management.
Institutional Creator: Bureau of Indian Affairs; Soil and Moisture Conservation Unit Cartographic Section, Concho, OK

title: Members of the Navajo Nation Attending the Klagetoh Meeting
Scopenote: Unidentified members of the Navajo nation attending the Klagetoh meeting, to discuss Bureau of Indian Affairs policies on range and livestock management. The meeting is on the Klagetoh reservation in Arizona.
Institutional Creator: Bureau of Indian Affairs; Soil and Moisture Conservation Unit Cartographic Section, Concho, OK

title: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash at the Klagetoh Meeting
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash shown at the lectern during the Klagetoh meeting of the Navajo Nation on their reservation in Arizona. The meeting addressed Bureau of Indian Affairs policies towards range and livestock management.
Institutional Creator: Bureau of Indian Affairs; Soil and Moisture Conservation Unit Cartographic Section, Concho, OK

title: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash addressing the attendees of the Klagetoh Meeting
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash addressing the attendees of the Klagetoh meeting of the Navajo Nation on their reservation in Arizona. The topic of the meeting was Bureau of Indian Affairs policies toward range and livestock management. Other attendees are unidentified.
Institutional Creator: Bureau of Indian Affairs; Soil and Moisture Conservation Unit Cartographic Section, Concho, OK

title: Annie Wauneka Addresses the Klagetoh Meeting
Scopenote: Annie Wauneka, Navajo tribal delegate from Klagetoh, runs the Klagetoh meeting held on the Navajo reservation in Arizona. The meeting included Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash (far right). The meeting addressed Bureau of Indian Affairs policies towards livestock and range management.
Institutional Creator: Bureau of Indian Affairs; Soil and Moisture Conservation Unit Cartographic Section, Concho, OK

title: James E. Webb (far right) Shown With Unidentified Couple
Scopenote: James E. Webb (far right), Director of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, is shown with unidentified couple at an unknown outdoor presentation; they are possibly an astronaut and his wife.

Album consists of photos of the former President addressing the dinner crowd and walking through the streets of Evansville. Donated by Mayor Frank P. McDonald.

title: Philleo Nash, Commissioner of Indian Affairs, speaks during the dedication of the Pine Ridge, South Dakota housing
Scopenote: Philleo Nash, Commissioner of Indian Affairs, speaks during the dedication of the Pine Ridge, South Dakota housing.  Several groups of Native American Indians are shown in the background and on the speakers platform.

title: Philleo Nash, Commissioner of Indian Affairs, speaking during the dedication of the Pine Ridge Housing development
Scopenote: Philleo Nash, Commissioner of Indian Affairs, speaks during the dedication of the Pine Ridge Housing development in South Dakota.

Scopenote: Profile portrait of Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash wearing western hat.

title: Senator Robert Kerr of Oklahoma with James E. Webb
Scopenote: Senator Robert Kerr of Oklahoma is shown with NASA Administrator James E. Webb at the Mariner II press conference.

title: Head and Shoulders Portrait of Former President Truman taken at Grinnell, Iowa
Scopenote: Portrait of former President Harry S. Truman taken at Grinnell, Iowa. Similar to photo 71-2583.

title: James E. Webb showing a model of a space vehicle to President John F. Kennedy in the oval office
Scopenote: James E. Webb, far right, showing a model of a space vehicle to President John F. Kennedy in the oval office.  James Webb is Director of NASA.  Others in photo unidentified.

title: President John F. Kennedy with James E. Webb and Others from NASA in Oval office
Scopenote: President John F. Kennedy (seventh from left) standing with unidentified others in front of his desk in the oval office being shown a model of a space vehicle.  James E. Webb, head of NASA, is fifth from left.

title: President John F. Kennedy, James E. Webb and others from NASA in the Oval Office
Scopenote: President John F. Kennedy (sixth from left) and unidentified others standing in front of his desk in the oval office being shown a model of a space vehicle. James E. Webb, NASA head, stands fourth from left.

title: President Kennedy with the Executive Council of  the National Congress of American Indians
Scopenote: President John F. Kennedy (fourth from the left) is shown with the Executive Council of  the National Congress of American Indians at the South Portico of the White House.  All others are unidentified.

title: President Kennedy speaks to the National Congress of American Indians
Scopenote: President John F. Kennedy (left, at microphone) speaks to the National Congress of American Indians on the South lawn of the White House near the Rose Garden.  All others unidentified.

title: Philleo Nash visits with Indian Children and an Indian Man During the USIA Indian Art Show
Scopenote: Philleo Nash visits with two Indian children and an Indian man in full headdress during the USIA Indian Art Show.

title: Philleo Nash Visits with Two Indian Children and an Indian man During the USIA Indian Art Show
Scopenote: Philleo Nash visits with two Indian children and an Indian man in headdress during the USIA Indian Art Show.

title: Philleo Nash With a group of Students From the Bureau of Indian Affairs Schools in Washington, D. C
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash (right) stands before a group of History/Government Conference students enrolled in the Bureau of Indian Affairs Schools in Washington, D. C.

title: Philleo Nash Lecturing Indian High School Students During the Bureau of Indian Affairs School held in Washington, D. C
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash is shown lecturing to a group of Indian high school students during the Bureau of Indian Affairs School held in Washington, D. C.

title: Philleo Nash Lectures a Students Enrolled in the Bureau of Indian Affairs Schools in Washington, D. C
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash (front right) lectures to a group of History/Government Conference Students enrolled in the Bureau of Indian Affairs Schools in Washington, D. C.  (See also 98-2537).

title: Philleo Nash with Top Students from the Student History/Government Conference at the Bureau of Indian Affairs School in Washington, D. C
Scopenote: Top students from various Indian High Schools attend the Student History/Government Conference at the Bureau of Indian Affairs School in Washington, D. C.  Commissioner Philleo Nash is shown in the center right.

title: National Service Program - Domestic Peace Corps Meeting, Pittsburg
Scopenote: Pictured are those in attendance at the National Service Program - Domestic Peace Corps meeting held at the Bureau of Mines, Pittsburg, Pennsylvania (See also 98-2533 and 98-2534).

title: Truman and Johnson at Truman Committee 22nd Anniversary Dinner
Scopenote: Color matted photo showing President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Lyndon B. Johnson and other distinguished guests at the 22nd Anniversary Dinner of the Truman Committee held in Washington, D.C. Seated to the right of Johnson is Tom Clark and to the left of Truman is Homer E. Ferguson who is seated fifth from the left, outside row of the table. Original photo is in oversize file. See also 2013-2268 for same photo.

title: Philleo Nash with Indian Employees of Donly Machine Specialties, Inc., Chicago
Scopenote: Philleo Nash with Indian employees and others of Donly Machine Specialties, Inc., Chicago, Illinois.  Mr. Nash is Commissioner of the Bureau of Indian Affairs.

Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash (with back to the camera) during his visit with Indian workers at the Donly Machine Specialties, Inc., Chicago, Illinois.

title: Philleo Nash with Indian Employees of Donly Machine Specialties, Inc., Chicago
Scopenote: Philleo Nash with Indian employees of Donly Machine Specialties, Inc., Chicago, Illinois.  Mr. Nash is Commissioner of the Bureau of Indian Affairs.

Scopenote: Two Project Mercury astronauts, Deke Slayton (left), and Scott Carpenter (2nd left), speak with two unidentified men in the Rose Garden at the White House during the presentation ceremony of the 1962 Collier Trophy.

Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash is shown with two unidentified people during a reception at the Jemez Day School (Pueblo tribe) in Albuquerque, New Mexico.

title: Philleo Nash Shown with Members of the Mountain Ute Tribe
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash shown with members of the Mountain Ute Tribe during one of Nash's visits.  The people are in full dress and a teepee is in the background. They are in Towaoc, Colorado.

title: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash (center) in full Chippewa Indian dress
Scopenote: Philleo Nash (in middle), the Commissioner of Indian Affairs, in full Indian dress.  Photo taken during ceremonies highlighting his adoption into the Red Lake Band of Chippewa Indians.  His Indian name will now be Gitchie Ahnishinabee Omega (Great Indian Leader).  Roger Jourdain is seen at left with the red sash hanging from his belt.

title: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash (second from left) in full Indian dress during ceremony with Chippewa Indians
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash (second from left) in full Indian dress, during ceremonies of his adoption into the Red Lake Band of Chippewa Indians.  His Indian name will now be Gitchie Ahnishinabee Ogema(Great Indian Leader).  Roger Jourdain (left) is seen with the red sash hanging from his belt.

title: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash shown in full Indian dress during his adoption into the Red Lake Band of Chippewa Indians
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash shown in full Indian dress during his adoption into the Red Lake Band of Chippewa Indians in Minnesota. His Indian name will now be Gitchie Ahnishinabee Ogema (Great Indian Leader).

title: Gemini IV photo of the Sonora Desert of Mexico and Colorado River
Scopenote: Gemini IV photo taken of the Sonora Desert of Mexico occupying the lower right hand part of the photo and a view of the mouth of the Colorado River on the left. Taken with a Hasselblad 500c, altitude of 110-120 nautical miles.

title: Philleo Nash Delivering a Speech at the Institute of Race Relations, Fisk University
Scopenote: Philleo Nash, Commissioner of Indian Affairs, delivering a speech at the Institute of Race Relations, Fisk University, Nashville, Tennessee.

title: Safety Management Conference at the Conrad Hilton Hotel in Chicago
Scopenote: Overall view of attendees at the Safety Management Conference held at the Conrad Hilton Hotel in Chicago, Illinois.

title: Philleo Nash at the Safety Management Conference
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash, front row, second from left, at the Safety Management Conference at the Conrad Hilton Hotel in Chicago.

title: Philleo Nash Speaks before a Safety Management Conference in Chicago
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs Philleo Nash speaks before a Safety Management Conference at the Conrad Hilton Hotel in Chicago.

title: James E. Webb Attending a Fund Raising Dinner for the Meridian House Foundation
Scopenote: James E. Webb (8th from left) shown attending a fund raising dinner with the Board of Trustees for the Meridian House Foundation.

title: James E. Webb Shown with Members of the Board of Trustees of the Meridian House Foundation
Scopenote: James E. Webb, head of NASA (left), shown with two members of the Board of Trustees of the Meridian House Foundation.  See also 98-185.

title: President Lyndon B. Johnson at the Truman Library with Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) and President Lyndon B. Johnson (second from left) stand with Robert Dennison (fourth from left) and John Snyder (sixth from left) at the Harry S. Truman Library during the ceremony sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University. They are standing in Mr. Truman's office at the Library.    From a green leather bound album of 17 photos, a gift from President Johnson.

title: Former President Truman and President Lyndon B. Johnson at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Truman and President Lyndon B. Johnson at the Harry S. Truman Library during the ceremony sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University.    From a green leather bound album of 17 photos, a gift from President Johnson.  These photos are the same as 66-9180 through 66-9196.

title: Earl Warren, Former President Truman, Bess Truman, and President Lyndon Johnson at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Left to right: Earl Warren, former President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and President Lyndon B. Johnson at the Harry S. Truman Library during the ceremony sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University. From a green leather bound album of 17 photos, a gift from President Johnson. These photos are the same as 66-9180 through 66-9196.

title: Photo of Two Audience Guests at the Truman Library during the Ceremony Sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University
Scopenote: Photo of two unidentified audience guests at the Harry S. Truman Library auditorium during the ceremony sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University.   From a green leather bound album of 17 photos, a gift from President Johnson.  This photo is the same as 66-9185.

title: Former President Truman, Mrs. Truman and President Lyndon Johnson during the Ceremony Sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University
Scopenote: Left to right:  former President Harry S. Truman, Mrs. Bess Truman and President Lyndon B. Johnson during the ceremony sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University at the Harry S. Truman Library auditorium.    From a green leather bound album of 17 photos, a gift from President Johnson.  These photos are the same as 66-9180 through 66-9196.

title: Former President Truman and President Johnson with others at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman and President Lyndon B. Johnson visit with others at the Harry S. Truman Library during a ceremony sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University. From a green leather bound album of 17 photos, a gift from President Johnson. This photo is the same as 66-9187.

title: Johnson addressing American Friends of Hebrew University ceremony
Scopenote: President Lyndon B. Johnson addressing the guests at the Harry S. Truman Library during the ceremony sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University.  Harry and Bess Truman and Earl Warren can be seen seated on the front row.  From a green leather bound album of 17 photos, a gift from President Johnson.  These photos are the same as 66-9180 through 66-9196.

title: Audience at the Truman Library, American Friends of Hebrew University ceremony
Scopenote: Photo of the audience at the Truman Library for the American Friends of Hebrew University ceremony, where President Lyndon B. Johnson addressed the crowd.    From a green leather bound album of 17 photos, a gift from President Johnson.  These photos are the same as 66-9180 through 66-9196.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman addressing the guests at the ceremony sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman addressing the guests at the ceremony sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University at the Harry  S. Truman Library.  Seated behind are Former President is Supreme Court Justice Earl Warren. President Lyndon B. Johnson is at back with arms crossed.  From a green leather bound album of 17 photos, a gift from President Johnson.  These photos are the same as 66-9180 through 66-9196.

title: Photo of aerial Ektachrome infrared film to detect insect infested timber in Oregon
Scopenote: Photo showing use of aerial Ektachrome infrared film to detect insect infested timber in Oregon.  Damaged trees appear blue-green and healthy trees appear red or pink.

title: Former President and Mrs. Truman, Earl Warren, and President Johnson walk in a Truman Library Hallway
Scopenote: Left to right: Former President Harry S. Truman, Earl Warren, Mrs. Bess Truman, and President Lyndon B. Johnson walking in a Truman Library hallway to attend a ceremony sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University. From a green leather bound album of 17 photos, a gift from President Johnson. These photos are the same as 66-9180 through 66-9196 (see 66-9192).

title: Former President Truman and President Lyndon B. Johnson at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman and President Lyndon B. Johnson at the Harry S. Truman Library in Mr. Truman's office.  President Johnson was visiting to attend a ceremony sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University.    From a green leather bound album of 17 photos, a gift from President Johnson.  These photos are the same as 66-9180 through 66-9196.

title: Former President Truman and President Lyndon B. Johnson in Mr. Truman's office in the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman and President Lyndon B. Johnson at the Harry S. Truman Library for the ceremony sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University. They are in Mr. Truman's office.  From a green leather bound album of 17 photos, a gift from President Johnson.  These photos are the same as 66-9180 through 66-9196.

title: Former President and Mrs. Truman with President Lyndon Johnson and Earl Warren at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Left to right: Bess Truman, President Lyndon B. Johnson, Earl Warren, and former President Harry S. Truman at the Harry S. Truman Library during the ceremony sponsored by the American Friends of Hebrew University.   From a green leather bound album of 17 photos, a gift from President Johnson.  These photos are the same as 69-9180 through 66-9196.

title: Photo of Light Spectrum from LIFE Space Tour of NASA's Ames Research Center
Scopenote: Photo of a light spectrum from LIFE Space Tour of NASA's Ames Research Center at Moffett Field, California.

title: Gemini V photo of the Great Bahama Banks
Scopenote: NASA Gemini V photo taken of the Great Bahama Banks. Depth of water on banks is 5 to 25 feet while in the tongue of the ocean (lower left) it is over one mile deep.

title: James E. Webb with an unidentified man in a military uniform
Scopenote: A smiling James E. Webb, head of NASA, is shown with an unidentified man, who is wearing a formal military costume, during the Goddard Memorial Dinner held at the Sheraton-Park Hotel in Washington, D.C.

title: Artist's Rendering of the Proposed Glennan Space Engineering Building in Cleveland, Ohio
Scopenote: Artist's rendering of the proposed $4 million Glennan Space Engineering Building being built as part of the Case Institute of Technology campus at Cleveland, Ohio.  The building will be named for former Case Institute of Technology President T. Keith Glennan, first administrator of NASA, and will be completed in September of 1968.

title: James E. Webb speaks to Senator John L. McClellan
Scopenote: James E. Webb, NASA head (second from left), speaks to Senator John L. McClellan (Arkansas), during McClellan's visit to the 16-foot Transonic Wind Tunnel of NASA Langley Research Center. McClellan stands with arms folded. The others are unidentified.

title: Senator John L. McClellan at NASA's Langley Research Center
Scopenote: Senator John L. McClellan (Arkansas), center, holds a model plane during his visit to the 16 foot Transonic Wind Tunnel at NASA's Langley Research center. Left to right: James E. Webb, NASA Administrator; Senator McClellan; Dr. Elmer B. Staats, Comptroller General of the United States; and Charles J. Donlan, Associate Director of Langley. The woman at right is unidentified.

title: Research Scientist in a Space Suit during a Demonstration
Scopenote: A research scientist in a space suit during a study of problems that will be encountered by man walking on the lunar surface during this demonstration. Senator John L. McClellan (second from right) communicates with the engineer. Observing the research are James E. Webb, NASA head (right); Dr. Floyd L. Thompson, Langley Director (second from left); and Donald E. Hewes, Langley scientist.

title: Senator John L. McClellan at the Controls of a Research Vehicle
Scopenote: Inspecting the research vehicle flown at the NASA Langley Research Center's Lunar Landing Research Facility are (from left) James E. Webb; Dr. Elmer B. Staats; Senator John L. McClellan of Arkansas (at controls); and Donald E. Hewes. They are in Hampton, Virginia.

title: Spacecraft engineers checking the Mariner E spacecraft
Scopenote: Spacecraft engineers at the NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory, Pasadena, California check the Mariner E spacecraft before shipment to Cape Kennedy, Florida for launching.

title: Satellite Nimbus II tracks Hurricane Beulah
Scopenote: The satellite Nimbus II as it tracks Hurricane Beulah across the Caribbean Sea, Gulf of Mexico and into Texas for two weeks in mid-September 1967. This series of photographs is representative of pictures received by Apt. Stations located in the U.S., Mexico and Caribbean area as Nimbus II orbited over these regions daily.

title: Rio Grande River in Texas taken by satellite Nimbus II
Scopenote: The Rio Grande River in Texas taken by Nimbus II during Hurricane Beulah. Nimbus II is a NASA satellite.

title: Charles J. Donlan with James E. Webb, and an unidentified man
Scopenote: Charles J. Donlan, Associate Director of the NASA Langley Research Center, (left) stands with James E. Webb, NASA Administrator (right) and another unidentified man (center).

title: Charles J. Donlan greets an unidentified man
Scopenote: Charles J. Donlan (right), Associate Director of the NASA Langley Research Center, greets an unidentified man while James E. Webb, NASA head (center) looks on.

title: Photo of the moon, autographed on the reverse to James E. Webb
Scopenote: Photo of the moon taken by Paul Feiler and autographed on the reverse to James E. Webb:  "This photograph of a moon picture by Pal Feiler in my collection may give some pleasure and distraction.  Anthony Michaelis. London, February 1968."

title: Informal portrait of former President Truman
Scopenote: Informal portrait (10x13, mounted to 16x20) of former President Harry S. Truman seated in a chair, holding his first formal press conference in several years at a Key West hotel.

title: Former President Truman at a Key West press conference
Scopenote: 10x13, mounted to 16x20 informal portrait of former President Truman seated in a chair, holding his first formal press conference in several years at a Key West hotel. Similar to 98-111.

title: President Lyndon B. Johnson, Lady Bird Johnson, Luci Baines Johnson Nugent and Patrick Lyndon Nugent with birthday cake on the White House lawn
Scopenote: President Lyndon B. Johnson, Lady Bird Johnson, Luci Baines Johnson Nugent and Patrick Lyndon Nugent with birthday cake on the White House lawn.    From a leather bound album of 22 photos of President Johnson and family at the White House.   A gift from President Lyndon B. Johnson.

title: Luci Baines Johnson Nugent and son Patrick Lyndon Nugent on the White House lawn
Scopenote: Luci Baines Johnson Nugent and son Patrick Lyndon Nugent celebrating Patrick's first birthday on the White House lawn.    From a leather bound album of 22 photos of President Johnson and family at the White House.   A gift from President Lyndon B. Johnson.

title: Patrick Lyndon Nugent on White House patio with toy
Scopenote: Patrick Lyndon Nugent on White House patio area with toy.    From a leather bound album of 22 photos of President Johnson and family at the White House.   A gift from President Lyndon B. Johnson.

title: Luci Baines Johnson Nugent and son Patrick Lyndon Nugent on the White House lawn
Scopenote: Patrick Lyndon Nugent and his mother, Luci Baines Johnson Nugent, on the White House lawn.    From a leather bound album of 22 photos of President Johnson and family at the White House.   A gift from President Lyndon B. Johnson.

Scopenote: James E. Webb, NASA head, is shown on the far right, with others, during a trip to the Arnold Engineering Development Center in Tennessee.

Scopenote: President Lyndon B. Johnson, Lady Bird Johnson, and grandson Patrick Lyndon Nugent on the White House lawn.  From a leather bound album of 22 photos of President Johnson and family at the White House.   A gift from President Lyndon B. Johnson.

title: Lucy Baines Johnson Nugent and son Patrick Lyndon Nugent on the White House lawn
Scopenote: Lucy Baines Johnson Nugent and son Patrick Lyndon Nugent on the White House lawn.    From a leather bound album of 22 photos of President Johnson and family at the White House.   A gift from President Lyndon B. Johnson.

Scopenote: Lynda Bird Johnson Robb with her infant daughter, Lucinda, in a pram in the Blue Room of the White House. It is Christmas in the White House.  From a leather bound album of 22 photos of President Johnson and family at the White House.   A gift from President Lyndon B. Johnson.

Scopenote: Four women in white coats and hard hats looking to their left, possibly in anticipation of President Lyndon B. Johnson's motorcade in the Fairview area of Independence, Missouri.  They are in front of a drugstore. President Johnson is visiting Independence, Missouri to attend the American Friends of Hebrew University ceremony at the Harry S. Truman Library.  From a leather bound album of 22 photos of President Johnson and family at the White House. A gift from President Lyndon B. Johnson.

Scopenote: Lynda Bird Johnson Robb and infant daughter Lucinda Robb in front of White House fireplace hung with Christmas stockings. They are in the Blue Room.  From a leather bound album of 22 photos of President Johnson and family at the White House.   A gift from President Lyndon B. Johnson.

Scopenote: Board of Directors of Sperry Rand Corporation. James E. Webb, former NASA Administrator, is seating first on the left. Twelve unidentified men seated around the table.

Scopenote: View of speakers' platform on the front steps of the Harry S. Truman Library during the Reserve Officers Association Fountain Dedication. From: Burgundy album, gift to Mrs. Truman from USAR Retired William H. Wymore.

Scopenote: Color Guard at the dedication of the "Harry S. Truman Annex" at the Naval Station in Key West, Florida.  From:  White leather album from unknown donor.

Scopenote: Three unidentified men at a speakers' table at unknown location, in photo relating to the dedication of the Reserve Officers Association fountains, a gift to the Harry S. Truman Library. From: Burgundy album, gift to Mrs. Truman from USAR Retired William H. Wymore.

Scopenote: Dr. Benedict K. Zobrist, Library Director, is shown with unidentified military officer at the podium on the front steps of the Harry S. Truman Library. Scopenote: View of the fountain dedicated by the Reserve Officers Association near the front entrance to the Harry S. Truman Library. From: Burgundy album, gift to Mrs. Truman from USAR Retired William H. Wymore.

title: View of flag display in courtyard of Truman Library
Scopenote: View of state flag display in the courtyard of the Harry S. Truman Library, looking toward grave site. From: Burgundy album, gift to Mrs. Truman from USAR Retired William H. Wymore.

Scopenote: Dr. Benedict Zobrist, Director, addressing crowd from a podium on the front steps of the Harry S. Truman Library. The occasion is the dedication of the fountains donated by the Reserve Officers Association. From: Burgundy album, gift to Mrs. Truman from USAR Retired William H. Wymore.

title: Viking 1 on the Surface of Mars
Scopenote: United States of America flag shown on the housing of Viking 1's nuclear power system on the surface of Mars.

title: Viking 1 photographed the crater Yuty
Scopenote: Viking 1 photographed the crater Yuty, located near the spacecraft's potential landing site on Mars.

title: This is the first coast-to-coast color photomosaic of the United States from satellite
Scopenote: This is the first coast-to-coast color photomosaic of the United States.  It is made from 569 virtually cloud-free images taken by NASA's Landsat Satellite orbiting at a height of 570 miles.

title: Viking 1 photo of cross indicates the aiming point for landing
Scopenote: Cross on this photo taken by Viking 1 indicates the aiming point for the landing on the surface of Mars.

title: Panoramic view by Viking 1 from Mars surface
Scopenote: First panoramic view by Viking 1 from the surface of Mars.  Note: top photo forms left half of panoramic view,  bottom photo should abut top photo for complete panorama.

title: First photograph ever taken of the surface of Mars
Scopenote: This is the first photograph ever taken on the surface of the planet Mars.  It was obtained by Viking 1 just minutes after the spacecraft landed.

title: Photo of Mars surface taken the day after landing
Scopenote: Photo of Mars taken July 21, 1976 - the day following the successful landing of Viking 1 on the planet Mars. The view is southeast from the Viking.

title: Viking 1 high-resolution photo of the surface of Mars
Scopenote: Viking 1 took this high-resolution picture of the surface of Mars.

title: White lines represent the first high resolution map of the Viking landing site
Scopenote: White lines which appear to be painted on the Martian surface represent the first high resolution map of the Viking 1 landing site constructed from Lander camera images.

title: Mars surface and sky taken from Viking 1
Scopenote: The surface and sky of Mars taken from Viking 1.

title: Photomosaic of a Mars area west of Argyre in the southern highlands
Scopenote: The photomosaic of a Mars area west of Argyre in the southern highlands was taken by the Viking Orbiter.

title: Excavated trench on Mars by Viking surface sampler
Scopenote: This image shows the trench excavated by Viking 1 surface sampler on Mars.

title: Northern latitudes of Mars photographed by Viking 1
Scopenote: This picture is one of many taken in the northern latitudes of Mars by the Viking 1 Orbiter in search of a landing site for Viking 2.

title: Montage of four photos shows one of the volcanoes in the Tharsis region of Mars
Scopenote: While the Viking 1 continues its analysis of the Martian surface, its companion ship, the Viking Orbiter, continues to obtain more startling pictures of the planet.  This montage of four photos shows one of the volcanoes in the Tharsis region near the equator.

title: High-Resolution photo of the Martian surface
Scopenote: High-resolution photo of the Martian surface near the Viking Lander 2 shows a few square yards at one of the possible spots for acquiring a soil sample.

title: Exterior photo of main entrance to the Harry S. Truman Museum and Library
Scopenote: Exterior photo of main entrance to the Harry S. Truman Museum and Library.  From:  Brown leather album, gift from George D. Clayton, Jr. of Hannibal, MO.

title: James E. Webb, NASA Administrator; Dr. Elmer B. Staats, Comptroller General of the U.S.; and Senator John L. McClellan of Arkansas
Scopenote: Shown during a visit to the NASA Langley Research Center are left to right:  James E. Webb, NASA Administrator; Dr. Elmer B. Staats, Comptroller General of the U.S.; and Senator John L. McClellan of Arkansas.  Also shown are Dr. Floyd L. Thompson (second from right), Langley Director, and Charles J. Donlan, Associate Director.

title: Probably the Arthur Raymond Home
Scopenote: Probably the Arthur Raymond home, home of the famous aeronautical engineer who received an award from NASA.

title: Exterior View of Apartment of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Raymond
Scopenote: Apartment of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Raymond while Mr. Raymond was a consultant to NASA.
